intro: Neoporteria hankeana var. taltalensis, commonly known as the Taltal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in maritime climates with moderate temperatures. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
